docs.snippet: There is no reason professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct....
docs.lead_paragraph: There is no reason professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct.
docs.abstract: Editorial maintains there is no reason that professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct, citing season tainted by on-field racial slurs and bullying scandal; welcomes new regulations meant to improve conduct, but argues there must also be an upward shift in society's expectations for athletes.

headline.main: The N.F.L. Begins to Wake Up
headline.print_headline: The N.F.L. Begins to Wake Up

docs.snippet: The former All-Pro safety Darren Sharper surrendered to the Los Angeles police after being named in a warrant involving a rape case in New Orleans....
docs.lead_paragraph: The former All-Pro safety Darren Sharper surrendered to the Los Angeles police after being named in a warrant involving a rape case in New Orleans.
docs.abstract: Former All-Pro safety Darren Sharper surrenders to the Los Angeles police after being named in a warrant involving a rape case in New Orleans; other football news noted.

docs.snippet: Kosovo will play its first FIFA-approved friendly on Wednesday, against Haiti, but many top soccer players with Kosovar heritage have ended up playing for other national teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kosovo will play its first FIFA-approved friendly on Wednesday, against Haiti, but many top soccer players with Kosovar heritage have ended up playing for other national teams.
docs.abstract: Kosovo prepares to play its first FIFA-approved friendly match, against Haiti, though without United Nations membership, country remains unable to officially join soccer's international governing body; many top soccer players of Kosovar heritage have ended up playing for other national teams.

headline.main: Kosovo Gets a Real Game, if It Can Assemble a Team
headline.print_headline: Kosovo Gets a Real Game, if It Can Assemble a Team

docs.lead_paragraph: Eradicating football violence in Argentina will be much harder than it was to get rid of hooligans in England, according to FA official Chris Whalley.

headline.main: Argentina Must Unite to Root Out Hooligans, Says Expert

docs.snippet: - A request from UEFA to change the so-called triple punishment rule has been rejected by soccer's law-making body while a proposal to study the use of video technology also got short shrift....

docs.snippet: Newcastle United manager Alan Pardew has been fined 100,000 pounds ($167,600) and given a formal warning by the club after being sent off for headbutting Hull City midfielder David Meyler during Saturday's Premier League match....
docs.lead_paragraph: Newcastle United manager Alan Pardew has been fined 100,000 pounds ($167,600) and given a formal warning by the club after being sent off for headbutting Hull City midfielder David Meyler during Saturday's Premier League match.

headline.main: Pardew Fined by Newcastle for Headbutting Player
headline.print_headline: Pardew Fined by Newcastle for Headbutting Player
